sources.title: "The Outlaw and His Wife" (1918) starring Victor Sjöström (Seastrom)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "The Outlaw and His Wife" is a Northern historical drama. This film illustrates the work of Victor Sjöström (Seastrom), a star of Silent Hall of Fame. Victor Seastrom is both the leading star of the film and its director.  He was successful in his native Sweden before making a career in the USA in 1924-1930. metadata.Plot: A stranger comes to work at widow Halla's farm. Halla and the stranger fall in love, but when he is revealed as Eyvind, an escaped thief forced into crime by his family's starvation, they flee and become two of the many outlaws of Iceland's mountains.
metadata.Writer: Victor Sjöström, Sam Ask, Jóhann Sigurjónsson
metadata.Actors: Victor Sjöström, Edith Erastoff, John Ekman
